7a4808c88aa5.title: This is a pretty incredible piece.

paragraphs.text: This is a pretty incredible piece. Thank you David Harper for writing it. I echo everyone one in saying that more long reads like this at The Ringer would be much appreciated. Wonderful stuff!

More of this, please. I’ve known the story of Image for years, but it’s always nice to hear it from another perspective. It’s especially interesting to see how perspectives change as the creators mature from the young hotshots to older veterans.

paragraphs.text: “with 1992’s Chicago Comic-Con needing a special tent in its parking lot just to accommodate their tens of thousands of supporters.”
paragraphs.name: dc59

paragraphs.text: I wouldn’t say “supporters” as much as “collectors looking to get signed copies and trying to cash in on the early 90s comic craze.”
paragraphs.name: cddb

virtuals.subtitle: I wouldn’t say “supporters” as much as “collectors looking to get signed copies and trying to cash in on the early 90s comic craze.”

1d981a6ed1cc.title: This article is the definitive history of IMAGE comics.

paragraphs.text: This article is the definitive history of IMAGE comics. It is so great and I approached it with dread as no one got the story right until now. My father owned a comic book store during this time and it truly was a revolution in comics both good and bad. And these guys made themselves available and understood marketing. They were rock stars to a growing crowd of comic geeks. Congratulations on a fantastic read.

3f4adc5a242.title: Of all the Image original creators, I think Jim Lee’s art evolved the best and looks the least…

paragraphs.text: Of all the Image original creators, I think Jim Lee’s art evolved the best and looks the least dated. Minus his unfortunate propensity for adding chin straps that seems to have made it into TV/movie versions of characters.

a34bb173b4e9.title: I think Image and modern comics is a little bit of a chicken vs.

paragraphs.text: I think Image and modern comics is a little bit of a chicken vs. egg scenario. An industry propelled at first by the splashy artists for a youthful audience grew into deeper writers geared towards mature storytelling. I think it’s no small coincidence that the comics industry rose and fell with my generation’s income and tastes.

237677e55d77.title: What a fantastic article, thank you.

paragraphs.text: What a fantastic article, thank you. The level of insight into this famous era of comic books was incredible, and as someone else mentioned this could be considered one of the definitive written pieces on the company’s history. Image has been notable since its inception, but I didn’t realize the negative effects they had on the industry in the mid-to…
